instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes BUT no USB activity
threads.message:
This board had liquid damage. It was initially bootlooping but it was wet inside and no noticeable corrosion. USC'd it and dried and day later it booted and ran video/heavy cpu activity on the bench for couple of hours. My tech reinstalled it and now it just chimes once and then no USB activity at all. Pulled it and on bench again and same result as in the chassis. 

USB shows continuous power just no activity.
Used Medusa for CleanME.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> remains present. 
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 1.8V. 

I was going to USC one more time as a hail mary unless you had suggestions.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes BUT no USB activity
threads.message:
There may be a GPU problem, blocking the board after chime.
Did you test starting in safe mode?

Just in case, try known good full BIOS.
